review: I've been eyeing the Chromecast for a while and finally bought one. Well... it was great, when it was working. It didn't occur to me that I'd have so much trouble with my wifi/router. Apparently Chromecast has recommended routers and internet providers, and my router (although outdated) wasn't one recommended and CenturyLink (my internet provider) doesn't offer many routers that are 'recommended' by Google. So instead of updating my router, to one I'm not sure will work with this device, I'll just have to send this back, which stinks. It set up really easily and would show up on my network. I'd be able to stream something from Netflix, but within a minute the Chromecast would disappear from my network and I was unable to control what I was streaming. Apparently there's a way to change your routers settings to allow it to multicast, but my router is too old to allow that. I'll probably need to look into updating my router before I give Chromecast another try. Check if you have a compatible router or if there's a way to work around an issue you have with streaming here...https://support.google.com/chromecast/table/3477832?hl=en
